result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin J Hervey Jr

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.L.

D.L. requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Court REMOVES the child from the no contact order. Court MODIFIES the no contact order to allow for third party contact for purpose of time with the child or exchange of the child at a police department district.

Defendant Melvin J Hervey Jr in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Melvin J Hervey Jr.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Oral No Contact Order with DDL and MH

Defendant Melvin J Hervey Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Melvin J Hervey Jr.  Attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case retabbed to DV intake judge of the week. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Melvin J Hervey Jr
Current: 3902 N 5th St, Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2022)
Prior: 117 West Ring Street Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
